title: Just like to reiterate how stupid some of the assassin reworks were *cough* akali *cough*
body:
Decided to put my shittalk into practice and play some ap tristana games, basically been looking for a new mid laner until akali's vgu so ricks shitty rework can be shot and put down.

Lets put it this way, i can w onto someone, e them auto them and ult them all just before i land and assuming nashors, lich bane, and ludens i will do a little under 400% ap ratio.

Even without mpen, that can still one shot any non tank in the game before they can even react to me.

My e does nearly 1k damage to towers at max stacks with full build, not counting the free 300 damage from lich bane that procs from pressing e.

My wave clear consists of eing a mob autoing them once then w'ing onto the wave to instantly clear the entire wave.

My w is an insane amount of utility with all the resets on it (and at 45% cdr it only has a 5 second cooldown) and the 60% slow.

And the roam potential is huge since you are basically just an insanely high burst lee sin using your ult, not full build yet but see your bot lane is getting bullied under tower? then roam bot and w flash ult for the tristsec, hell you can even avoid wards by flashing over the wall near the tower then wing behind the adc for the ult.

its an off meta pick, that was nerfed a year ago, and is still beter than current akali, Does more damage than pre-rework akali but i wouldnt say shes better than pre-rework akali as pre-rework akali was all about that clutch sustain.

replies.body: the thing is, if you use your jump to engasge anywhere higher than bronze, you will get you shit kicked in by the enemy team

If you use your akali ult to engage anywhere higher than bronze, you will get your shit kicked in by the enemy team.

Ftfy

The difference that made akali viable was her sustain, thats what allowed her to dive into the middle of your team and survive long enough to kill that carry (assuming you did that and didnt instantly get hard cc'd but we could dream)

In akalis current state every argument you can make against ap trist, also applies to akali thus making ap trist an objectively better akali.
